content: Tatjana Chavdarova ‚Äì Game Theory, Machine Learning, Variational Inequalities Hello! I‚Äôm Tatjana (pronounced /tatiana/), currently a Visiting Professor in the Department of Electronics, Information and Bioengineering (DEIB) at Politecnico di Milano (Polimi), where I research and teach in the areas of game theory, machine learning, variational inequalities, multi-agent systems, and optimization algorithms. I collaborate with Nicola Gatti and Nicol√≤ Cesa-Bianchi. I hold a Ph.D. from EPFL, and Idiap, advised by Fran√ßois Fleuret. During my doctoral studies, I interned at (i) Mila with Yoshua Bengio and Simon Lacoste-Julien, and at (ii) DeepMind under Irina Jurenka (Higgins). After my Ph.D., I was a Postdoctoral Researcher at EPFL‚Äôs MLO Lab with Martin Jaggi, and later at UC Berkeley EECS with Michael Jordan. ¬ª We‚Äôre excited to host the DynaFront Workshop at NeurIPS 2025! Visit the workshop website for details. ¬ª The Games in ML '25 course materials are available here. Research Interests I work at the intersection of game theory and machine learning, developing AI systems that learn, strategize, and interact in multi-agent environments. My research spans: Learning in Games ‚Äì How do AI models (e.g., neural networks) adapt and compete in strategic settings? Can we design better learning algorithms for stability and efficiency? Reinforcement Learning ‚Äì learning dynamics in competitive multi-agent and actor-critic settings. Generative Modeling & Robustness ‚Äì Studing and improving generalization and adversarial resilience in AI. Algorithmic Game Theory ‚Äì modeling complex multi-agent systems such as from microeconomics, mechanism design, and developing learning algorithms. ¬ª Outside of research, I‚Äôm passionate about the broader implications of games‚Äînot just for AI, but for developing human inteligence and society. (For fun: I recommend this talk by Kelly Clancy on how games shape our world!) News: second-half, 2025: Dynamical systems tools for ML are in vogue! We're hosting a NeurIPS workshop titled Dynamics at the Frontiers of Optimization, Sampling, and Games (DynaFront). Also super excited about the special 20th anniversary edition of the WiML workshop -- keep an eye on WiML announcements ;) See you in San Diego! July, 2025: I'll be at ICML! Come check out our work on game-theoretic federated learning, where agents operate without full knowledge of others' strategies. We're also organizing the WiML workshop/symposium on Wednesday and co-hosting a social event on Thursday‚Äîplus more! Looking forward to seeing you in Vancouver! May, 2025: I am giving "Games in Machine Learning" PhD-level course at PoliMi, starting from late May. Course materials are available here! Sept., 2024: Very excited to be working with Nicola Gatti, Alberto Marchesi, Matteo Castiglioni, and the remaining game theory and reinforcement learning team at PoliMi and Milano! July, 2024: I will be at the ISMP conference and talk about HRDEs for VIs (slides below). See you in Montr√®al! PS - if you're attending ICML, don't miss out WiML's events! Jan, 2024: You have two- or multi-player problem with constraints? use our ACVI method -> accepted at ICLR 2024.
